membership:
Founded in 1998, the "Royal Spas of Europe". Members are traditional spas which have a rich history and tradition of royal patronage - counting kings, queens and emperors, dukes and all branches of the aristocracy among their guests and offering an infrastructure with an exceptional quality of expertise and excellence. 
 
The ESPA was coordinator of an EU funded project "RomanSpas of Europe" which has brought European thermal spas and health resorts which are from Roman origin. 
 
ESPA supports the Tourism for Growth and Jobs Manifesto initiative of the European tourism stakeholders. 
 
The ESPA is in close cooperation with the International Society of Medical Hydrology and Climatology (ISMH). 
 
The ESPA is official member of the CALPYSO action group of the tourism unit of the EU. As well as member of their senior expert group. 
 
The two certificates EUROPESPA med and EUROPESPA wellness signify international standards of quality as defined by ESPA. 
 
Members benefits:  
 
■Commercial success thanks to high levels of quality certified by a well known association.  
 
■PR and communication via the international web portal: www.europespa.eu .  
 
■Outstanding reputation in their own sector and among their main clients.    
 
■Continuous improvement to international top quality within just a few years.  
 
■Anonymous quality checks to keep them aware of their own position against international competition.  
 
Criteria and auditing 
The some 400 audit questions for EUROPESPA med are based on 4 main sets of national and international rules on safety, hygiene and therapy infrastructure. 
For EUROPESPA wellness (safety, hygiene, wellness infrastructure and service quality), about 350 questions are examined on your premises while another 600 items regarding service quality are tested anonymously. 
At least 80% of all the criteria as well as certain basic requirements have to be met. These results are then compared to subsequent audits to ensure that continuous mprovement takes place.

goals__remit:
ESPA was founded in 1995 in Brussels as an umbrella association for national spa associations in Europe.  
 
It is a non-profit and non-governmental association based on Belgian law (A.I.S.B.L.)  
It has represented the interests of European spas and health resorts in Brussels. 
 
 
Our mission: 
 
■Align health resorts within the European healthcare market 
 
■More fairness in competition by quality 
 
■Promote a clear distinction between health resort therapy and recreational services (wellness) 
 
 
Since the beginning, ESPA has built up a close network of contacts with policymakers as well as leading representatives of science and business. 
This goes to benefit above all our members – for only with a strong association the opportunities offered by Europe can be used to the full.  
 
Services benefiting ESPA members  
 
■Network of and for health resort and spa experts 
 
■Certification of health resorts and spa facilities (EUROPESPA) 
 
■Consultation on legislation and regulation in the member states 
 
■Contacts by communication and collaboration with members and operators in Europe and worldwide 
 
■Support for research and the provision of information 
 
■Development of health resorts and spas together with experts
